description: From New Latin, from Ancient Greek πυξίδιον (puxídion), diminutive of πῠξῐ́ς (puxís, “box”).

entries.meaning: (botany) A seed capsule in the form of a box, the seeds being released when the top splits off.
examples: Key to Species of Cariniana Inflorescence predominantly terminal and subterminal; pyxidium without teeth at line of opercular dehiscence.
